This is what I would do:
Define a new solution object, then set its propert=
ies using the 
properties of the existing solution, like this example for 
=
temperature, pressure, and composition:

gas 1 already exists...

gas2 =3D =
GRI30;
set(gas2,'T',temperature(gas1),'P',pressure(gas1),'X',moleFractions
=
(gas1));

I am not an expert programmer, so there may be a slicker way to d=
o it.

Andrew

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, Michele Vascellari <vascella=
ri@...> 
wrote:
>
> Dear all,
> I have the following trouble using the Cant=
era toolbox for Matlab.
> I need to create a new solution object starting f=
rom an existing 
one.
> I've tried to copy the first object using the equal=
 operator (=3D), 
but in 
> this way the two objects have the same handles.=
 In fact changing 
> something in one object, I change also the other one.
=
> Is there some way to create a new solution object starting from a 
> prev=
ious one with a different handles?
>

Michele
